body.name: WubbaNub Infant Pacifier - Hippo
features: WubbaNub Brand- The Original Pacifier/Plush Animal combination
Durable one piece construction is both functional and stylish. Patented design makes it easy for baby to grasp
Distributed in hospitals, NICU and well-baby units nationwide
Made with 100% silicone pacifier. Latex free, BPA, PVC and Phthalate free
Recommended for newborns through six months. (Not suggested for babies with teeth or in teething stage)

productInformation.name: Safety warning
productInformation.value: ‎Do not tie pacifier around child's neck as it presents strangulation danger.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Fall in love with our award winning WubbaNub Pacifier, the original part plush, part pacifier. The patented WubbaNub design is sure to be your baby’s first friend. The unique style of the original WubbaNub Pacifier allows it to remain near baby’s mouth, easy to grasp, nearly impossible to lose and may assist baby to self soothe. WubbaNub is distributed in hospitals, NICU and well-baby units nationwide and is made with a 100% silicone pacifier, a non-latex and BPA, PVC and Phthalate-free. The durable one-piece construction of the pacifier means no germs hiding between cracks. WubbaNub is a safety-first company that mandates all infant/baby products are completely safety tested. NOTE: WubbaNub Pacifiers purchased online are packaged in a clear polybag with header card that further describes features and benefits.

Black and White Penguin What’s black, white, and cute all over? Black & White Penguin, of course! From its eye-catching colors and soft, soothing material, this baby penguin is sure to comfort and delight even the fussiest of babies. Perfectly sized for tiny hands to grasp, the unique design of our plush pacifier allows it to remain close and easily positioned by baby. Penguin measures approximately 7x5x2 inches. Baby Hippo Though bashful and shy, WubbaNub Baby Hippo is gentle, lovable and always playful. Her super-soft plush body will be sure to capture the attention of your baby. The unique style of the WubbaNub pacifier allows it to remain close and easily positioned by the baby. Measures approximately 7 x 5 x 2 inches. Pink Owl What a hoot! This pretty Pink Owl is wise, calm and observant. Her feet are designed for little hands to easily grasp, while her wide eyes are kind and soothing. The unique style of the WubbaNub pacifier allows it to remain close and to be easily positioned by your baby. Measures approximately 6 x 6 x 2 inches Tabby Kitten WubbaNub Tabby Kitten is purrfectly pretty, peaceful, and placid. Tabby Kitten’s petite tail is the perfect size for little hands to hold onto. The unique style of the WubbaNub pacifier allows it to remain close and easily positioned by the baby. Measures approximately 6 x 5 x 2 inches

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars We love our hippos 🦛
reviews.reviewText: We have had several Wubbanub pacifiers between kids over the years.This by far is my favorite! It’s super soft. Too stinking cute! My daughter loves it. Very happy with it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 11, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Bought it as a gift for few new mamas and they all loved it! Must important, their little ones enjoyed it right away as well. Perfect fit.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 8, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars One of the best wubbanubs
reviews.reviewText: This hippo has the perfect sized everything. Not too long of arms that get in the way of baby trying to suck. Sturdy neck. Good color that doesn’t get too dirty too fast. Not too bulky of a body that won’t get in the way when inside the moby wrap. I’ve had a lot of wubbanubs for both my girls and this one is one of the best ratios for sitting nicely on baby & not having stuff in the way.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2016
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Wubbanub Pacifier Review
reviews.reviewText: When my LO was born I had bought many pacifiers and pacifier clips. They worked all right, but I didn't really like how the strap was so long on the pacifier clip. If not attached properly the pacifier clip strap could get wrapped around the infants neck and that was something that constantly worried me. I decided to try out a Wubbanub pacifier, I bought the Wubbanub Bear (Pink) and immediately knew this would be my "go to" pacifier brand. I loved how the pacifier was attached to the super soft and adorable plush bear. Plus, I don't have to worry about any long straps that could possibly strangle my baby. The pacifier is sewn onto the plush which to me, makes finding the pacifier much easier when I am looking for one. We all know how hard it seems to be to find a pacifier when we need one the most. I recently ordered the Hippo and Confetti Bear and they are exactly what I expected them to be. I now have 3 and my LO loves them as much as I do. Such a great product and I highly recommend. They also make great gifts!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 2, 2016
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Wubbanub has preserved my sanity!
reviews.reviewText: I LOVE Wubbanub! Any parent who has attempted to dig a pacifier out from under her infant's butt in the car seat/off the backseat floorboards/out from between the seats or wherever it managed to fall to while listening to her child scream and simultaneously keeping her foot on the brake at that impossibly short red light recognizes the value of Wubbanub. Not only are they adorable (A-DOR-A-BLE!!) little critters, but they keep pacifiers accessible when the baby spits them out. I can find the Wubbanub behind my back in the dark while driving and preserve what's left of my sanity while replugging the (really cute and very much loved) baby. Because it keeps the pacifier relatively secure, he has even found it again himself even though he is too young to have the fine motor skills to pick it up. These will be my go-to baby shower gift for the rest of my life!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 19, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Daughter loves these
reviews.reviewText: My daughter is 17 months old and obsessed with this. I know i know out of the recommended age group but some babies have blankies or teddy bears they attach to, she attached to this. Only the hippo and she calls it hiphop. She does use the binky to sleep at night but it's more about the stuffy at this point. It was great when she was little because they don't fall out of the crib like a binky and much easier for her to find on her own in the dark. Cleaning them i haven't really figured out because the binky is attached so i keep having to buy new ones and hoping she does't notice. She has two at all times. I've never had one year or detach either and she's rough on them.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2016
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best binky ever created!
reviews.reviewText: My daughter, almost 1, has used only WubbaNubs since she was born. About 15 years ago I stumbled upon a duck WubbaNub at a local baby boutique and got it for a newborn cousin; at the time, only the duck and red puppy were available, and my cousin toted them with her everywhere for years. She adored them. When I found out I was pregnant, the choice of binky for my new arrival was simple. Between my mother and I my daughter has probably 15+ WubbaNub (we're in deep and like collecting the different animals) and is a certified addict. Sometimes she'll have one in her mouth and carry another in her hand and periodically switch. I've bought her the Soothie pacifiers only to keep in case of emergency in the car or diaper bag and while those binks are okay, they are in no way equal to the real deal with the attached animals. I toss them in the washer in a lingere bag when they start to look grubby and they come out clean every time. My daughter can find these in her crib when 3/4s asleep in the dark, a real lifesaver. Stroking the stuffed animal body helps her relax, and sometimes simply holding it in her hands without putting the pacifier part into her mouth is all she needs to calm down. I recommend WubbaNubs to all expecting moms I know. My personal favorite is the penguin but hers is this hippo. :)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2017
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great for the car and doubles as a lovey when it is time to lose the paci!
reviews.reviewText: All of the wubanubs are great because when it is time to lose the paci they still have a lovey! I just cut the paci off when it was time and the boys still love their little animals :) They are 2 now and use them as their loveys:) When they were little they were great because they were easier to find than a lose paci, especially in the car when the loose pacis tended to fall into little gaps in the car.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on March 4, 2018
reviews.reviewText: Just as expected- excited to try it.
